summary: The Houthi Human Rights Accountability Act mandates sanctions and reports related to the Houthis in Yemen. It calls for reports on Houthi indoctrination efforts, obstacles to humanitarian aid, and human rights abuses including gender-based violence, child soldier recruitment, and unlawful killings.  The bill authorizes sanctions under the Global Magnitsky Act and the Robert Levinson Hostage Taking Act targeting members of the Houthis involved in human rights violations or hindering aid. The Act sunsets after 5 years.
